artist: Unknown Japanese; Tsuba by Ōmori Terumasa
description: a. Sword metal blade with snake decoration and 3 peg holes in tang that has also a gold lacquer signature; signed tsuba with soft metalwork decoration of dragon amidst waves; grip is wrapped, dragon head on tip, 2 silver menuki in form of a tiger on one side and a lion on the other; b. Scabbard lacquer with horimono (metal decoration) at end in form of dragon wrapped around sword, gold and silver mounts; fabric tie
marks: on blade in gold lacquer: 長識 {Chōshoku} plus seal on tsuba: 幹支間　英昌 {Kanshiken Terumasa} plus seal
medium: Metal, gold, silver; tsuba: gold, shakudo overlaid and carved shibuichi
title: Blade with engraved snake for a long-sword (Koto-katana) and mounting with dragon decoration
